skillTree.localised_description: A Chaos Steed makes a fierce and intimidating mount for any conniving Sorcerer Lord.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: The already-fierce Chaos Steeds are often covered in heavy armour, making them even deadlier.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: Manticores are highly prized by Sorcerers, for they are creatures bathed in magic and as cruel as their riders.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Chaos Dragons were once noble rulers of the skies, now split and corrupted by the forces of Change.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
The followers of Chaos need not to rest, they march on with iron hearts desperate to harvest souls.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in battle, this Lord will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.
When cast this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Enfeebling Foe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The Wizard destroys their enemies from within, corroding foes' minds with doubt and crisis.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Withering"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Withering Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Withering Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Penumbral Pendulum"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The supernatural solution is often the best; weapons materialise before the caster's allies, allowing them to slice through flesh, soul, and consciousness.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Okkam's Mindrazor"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.
A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.
To the Northmen, there is no greater honour than to fight and perish under the gaze of the Gods.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Chaos Marauders, Aspiring Champions, and Forsaken units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +6 for Chaos Marauders, Aspiring Champions, and Forsaken units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Chaos Marauders, Aspiring Champions, and Forsaken units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for Chaos Marauders, Aspiring Champions, and Forsaken units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Chaos Marauders, Aspiring Champions, and Forsaken units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Khorne’s will imbues his creatures with a vicious, unslakeable hunger for battle.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +6 for Marauder Horsemen, Marauder Horsemaster, Chaos Warhounds, and Chaos Feral Manticore units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Marauder Horsemen, Marauder Horsemaster, Chaos Warhounds, and Chaos Feral Manticore units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Marauder Horsemen, Marauder Horsemaster, Chaos Warhounds, and Chaos Feral Manticore units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 for Marauder Horsemen, Marauder Horsemaster, Chaos Warhounds, and Chaos Feral Manticore units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Marauder Horsemen, Marauder Horsemaster, Chaos Warhounds, and Chaos Feral Manticore units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Unnatural strength, an aura of dark menace, an unwavering devotion to the Chaos Gods – some warriors have undoubtedly been touched by the Ruinous Ones.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Chaos Warriors, Chaos Spawn, and Chosen units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Chaos Warriors, Chaos Spawn, and Chosen units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Chaos Warriors, Chaos Spawn, and Chosen units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Chaos Warriors, Chaos Spawn, and Chosen units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Chaos Warriors, Chaos Spawn, and Chosen units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Breaking bones and ending lives, the armies of Chaos strike like an unholy hammer crashing through their enemies' ranks.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +6 for Dragon Ogres, Chaos Knights, Gorebeast Chariot, and Chaos Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Dragon Ogres, Chaos Knights, Gorebeast Chariot, and Chaos Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Dragon Ogres, Chaos Knights, Gorebeast Chariot, and Chaos Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 for Dragon Ogres, Chaos Knights, Gorebeast Chariot, and Chaos Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Dragon Ogres, Chaos Knights, Gorebeast Chariot, and Chaos Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Hulks of pure muscle, held upright by unsullied hatred, can crush a man with a frightening lack of effort.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Dragon Ogre Shaggoth, Chaos Trolls, and Chaos Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Dragon Ogre Shaggoth, Chaos Trolls, and Chaos Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Dragon Ogre Shaggoth, Chaos Trolls, and Chaos Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Dragon Ogre Shaggoth, Chaos Trolls, and Chaos Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 for Dragon Ogre Shaggoth, Chaos Trolls, and Chaos Giant units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Doomfire is a gift from Khorne, to ensure the Hellcannons speak with extra fury.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +6% for Hellcannon units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Hellcannon units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The legions march forth under the Lord's inscrutable gaze, eager to kill for fear of his wrath.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +12% for Chaos Marauders, Chaos Warriors, Forsaken, Aspiring Champions, and Chosen units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Chaos Marauders, Chaos Warriors, Forsaken, Aspiring Champions, and Chosen units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Magic resistance: 15% for Chaos Marauders, Chaos Warriors, Forsaken, Aspiring Champions, and Chosen units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The worthiest of Chaos' vanguard are blessed with the most elaborate mutations, which also enable them to run faster for longer.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 15% for Chaos Warhounds, Chaos Chariot, Gorebeast Chariot, Chaos Knights, Dragon Ogres, and Chaos Feral Manticore units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Chaos Warhounds, Chaos Chariot, Gorebeast Chariot, Chaos Knights, Dragon Ogres, and Chaos Feral Manticore units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Chaos Warhounds, Chaos Chariot, Gorebeast Chariot, Chaos Knights, Dragon Ogres, and Chaos Feral Manticore units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Mutations awarded by the Chaos Gods to their followers may look horrific to southerners, but such gifts are prized.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 15% for Chaos Trolls, Chaos Spawn, Chaos Giant, and Dragon Ogre Shaggoth units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Chaos Trolls, Chaos Spawn, Chaos Giant, and Dragon Ogre Shaggoth units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Chaos Trolls, Chaos Spawn, Chaos Giant, and Dragon Ogre Shaggoth units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Impossible foresight is granted to a few among the ranks of the Ruinous armies, allowing them to land the critical blow upon their foes.

effects.description:
Reload time reduction: +10% for Hellcannon, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +15% for Hellcannon, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Hellcannon, Marauder Horsemen and Marauder Horsemasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
A Lord that was once part of the tribes - one who rode the great Norscan migrations - can summon his kin.
"This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +15% when laying siege
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for Lords
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The Dark Apothecaries mix their fell unguents, ensuring those that can continue to serve.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The masses flock to the Lord of Chaos - a dread time will soon fall on the weaklings in the south.
This being must be touched by Tzeentch, seeing things before they happen.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +8%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption - as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Oh, horrific wonder! Vile awe! Such hateful majesty!
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit ignores speed and combat penalties caused by terrain and can move through trees.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.
Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +5
	(all armies factionwide)

Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve: -5
	(local region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.
